event.name: Holiday Party
foodTips: Holiday appetizers should be elevated - cheese boards, shrimp cocktail, stuffed mushrooms.
Sweet treats are expected - have a dessert station with cookies and holiday candies.
Warm appetizers disappear 40% faster in winter - plan accordingly.
Dietary restrictions matter more at holidays - have vegetarian and gluten-free options clearly labeled.
If it's a potluck, assume 30% of guests will forget to bring something.
event.foodBuyingGuide: Holiday parties are about elevated comfort food. Plan 8-10 appetizer pieces per person for a cocktail-style party. Include a mix of hot and cold options, with at least one 'showstopper' like a cheese board or charcuterie spread.
proTips: Red wine outsells white 2:1 at winter holidays - adjust accordingly.
Festive signature cocktails are expected - plan for mixers like cranberry juice and eggnog.
70% of champagne at NYE is consumed between 11:30pm and 12:15am - time your chilling.
Warm drinks like mulled wine and hot toddies are crowd pleasers in cold months.
People drink 20% more at company holiday parties than other corporate events.
event.buyingGuide: Holiday parties call for festive options. Stock extra red wine and have ingredients for 1-2 seasonal cocktails (mulled wine, spiked cider, or classic eggnog). For NYE specifically, double your champagne order and have everything chilled by 11pm.

meta.title: How Much Appetizers for 20 Guests Holiday Party? | 9 platters
meta.description: Need appetizers for a 20-person holiday party? You'll need exactly 9 platters. Free calculator with pro tips for party planning.
meta.h1: How Much Appetizers for a 20 Guests Holiday Party?

mathExplanation.label: Estimate actual eaters
mathExplanation.explanation: At small events, about 95% of guests will eat full servings.

mathExplanation.label: Calculate servings (as main dish)
mathExplanation.explanation: As a main dish, plan for 8 pieces per person.

mathExplanation.label: Apply holiday party modifier
mathExplanation.explanation: Holiday Partys typically consume 50% more appetizers than average.

mathExplanation.label: Add 15% buffer & round up
mathExplanation.explanation: Always round up and add a buffer. Running out of food is worse than having leftovers!
